website_summaries.verdict: Easy phone removal make this a favorite. Solid hold on dashboard makes it hard to beat.
pros: Telescopic arm gives a full 2 inches of viewing adjustment
Once attached, it holds tight for the long haul
cons: Could damage certain types of dashboards
It's best to check your car model before attaching

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: This mount does what it says but it definitely could be better. The suction cup is definitely the best part. To put it simply, if done right, it will not come off on its own no matter how recklessly you drive. The mount itself is pretty big and clunky. It has a very cheap feel even for a 10 dollar mount. The one touch feature is not very impressive and is kind of annoying. Summary: If you want a cheap mount that does the job and you don't care what it looks like then this is the mount for you.
customer_reviews.author: xamazonx

customer_reviews.title: Rocky device
customer_reviews.text: This device was not as nice as the product it replaced. It is kludgy to place your phone in securely where it actually rests in the correct position. The clamps are noisy and the device clamps every time you put your phone in the cradle. The worst issue for me is that the phone doesn't sit flush against the back place so when you try to touch the phone display the phone rocks either upward or downward when you use the phone's touch display.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: By far the best car mount hold out there!
customer_reviews.text: iOttie is rated number 1 for car mounts because of this product. Application couldn't be easier - I have it fixed to my windshield, and being in Australia we experience temps up to 120F and the quality has not degraded nor has the pad lost it's stickiness due to the heat (which I thought it would!) The application couldn't be simpler - it comes with a backup pad too, the arm is fully adjustable, in 2 places, and I have a wider phone, and the phone (Samsung galaxy note 4) fits in snug and perfectly, even with a large shock-proof rubber case! Removal is just as easy, with the two clips on the side. What a perfect little ripper!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted...
customer_reviews.text: I drive for my job and use the phone holder very often. I love this cell phone holder better than anything I've owned because it sits at the right angle, and I can adjust it closer to me. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it lasted only 2 years. Perhaps I'm a little picky on asking for more longevity, but you be the judge as to whether it's worth it for you to replace this holder every 2 years. I bought it again, so until I see a better holder, I'll probably keep buying this one as long as the price stays low.
customer_reviews.author: Believer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this installed for just at a week. It hasn't weathered the extreme temperatures we get at our home yet, but anticipating potential issues with adhesive when my vehicle approaches 49 C degrees, I installed it on the dash rather than the windshield. It is flexible enough to position easily where I can see the screen to use the navigation feature and the brace meeting the bottom of the phone adjusts to accommodate a charging cord. The only difficulty I had was initially navigating the assembly, which is a little tricky but patience wins out. Don't force the pieces together, as they are plastic. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Paige L. Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: It holds like no other.
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my tractor trailer rig at work, and while I have read the other reviews stating that it is difficult to remove the adhesive pad, I have not tried that myself. I can however attest to the fact that this holder does what it is suppose to do, and does it well. It has handled up to the riggers of by bouncing rig over many miles, and never let me down. Not sure what will happen when I get a new truck, but that's way down the road for now. I use it all the time for my phones gps capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Dtown40

customer_reviews.title: One of the best window cellphone mounts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cellphone mount three years ago and it was mounted to the windshield in the same vehicle for over three years and only fell off once. I've used large phones like the Pixel 2XL and Pixel 3a XL with it and had no issues. Phone stays securely mounted and minimal movement while driving. After three years I removed it (yes, it is hard to remove from the windshield, I suggest using a plastic shim or something similar to pry it off) and mounted temporarily for a trip in another vehicle. The cons?....it's not free??....lol.
customer_reviews.author: Unixman2000

customer_reviews.title: Held strong to windshield for 3 years
customer_reviews.text: This worked great in my windshield for 3 years, it has finally fallen off and the suction cup left a ton of residue. I scraped it off with a razor blade so it wasn't a big deal. Id be careful with any suction cup on a dash though. I am happy with my 3 years of use I got out of this and would buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: P S

customer_reviews.title: Secure and Compatible
customer_reviews.text: Use: On vehicle dashboard with iPhone 7 Pros: Suction Power, Adhesion (Washable, Reusable), Phone Secure, Bottom Foot Adjustable, Entire Mount is Adjustable Cons: Due to high heat in my area during the summer I have to re-adhere mount I have utilized this mount for many years in various vehicles and with various phones. It has worked well in each vehicle and with each phone. I like that the adhesion pad can be rinsed and after drying it is sticky again an ready for re-use. I highly recommend this long-lasting item to others looking for a car mount for their phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best but with a flaw
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over four years on two different cars and it just worked perfectly. You should definitely buy it. I will say do not mount it on your dashboard because as you can see from the other pictures it does not come off. Now the one flaw it does have is that the suction cup is not heat resistance so after almost 5 years baking in the sun it is melted and deform to the point where it does not sick anymore. but for the price and the longevity I'm going to buy another one! If they made the suction cup out of heat proof silicone it would be the perfect product🙏
customer_reviews.author: boycrazyboy

customer_reviews.title: It melts...
customer_reviews.text: This has been an okay phone holder in our vehicle but the suction cup melts! We are in northern Virginia and as you can see the suction cup melts and will ruin your dashboard. It will leave a disgusting, very difficult to clean, goop on your dashboard. The picture shows you what has melted and been left on our dashboard. Other than that, it has worked.
customer_reviews.author: Biased Perspective

customer_reviews.title: Loose fit
customer_reviews.text: I have an iPhone XR. This holder does not support phone with pop socket attached. Even with nothing on the phone, it is not a secure fit. Phone pops out of the holder whenever you run over a speedbump, pothole, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Agalm

customer_reviews.title: Not iOttie brand, cheap knock-off.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought this iOttie car mount twice in the past and have been pleased with them. But this time, a cheap knock-off was sent. It’s lighter and feels cheaper than the other ones. The ones I have came in a nice box, complete with instructions. This one was unbranded and with no instructions, like something you’d buy in a dollar store. I’m not willing to pay the same full-price for this one. I’m returning and buying somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: On my 2nd one...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned 2...and they're just not that great. I feel that there are many other competitors in the same price range that offer more. The rubber suction cup is just cheap. Here you can see it just melting and leaving behind a sticky residue on the glass. It's concerning when your $1,000 phone falls down in the car while driving. Yes, my windshield was perfectly clean before mounting it.
customer_reviews.author: Lightningslp77

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Product
customer_reviews.text: It is such a pleasure to have my phone accessible while I drive and it is handsfree. This is a great little product because it works as advertised. I did not use it on my dash because anything being fastened to your dash will ultimately stain it, not just this product. Instead, I fastened it to my windshield and it has not budged. I wound up ordering a second one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Diogenes Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Dock your phone and keep your hands on the wheel. Drive with Focus!
customer_reviews.text: Holds phone strong also will with stand high vibrations over the roads while driving. I will stress this if you have the base suction is clear and if the sun will melt the edges and use the iOttie pad sticker pad to your dashboard, also I do cover the holder with a white Terry cloth to slow the process of melting the base cup. If you have high humid areas it will unstick also why I cover it with a cloth to minimize that issue. Once a month clean your base with warm water and and air dry if it unstick issue and clean your dash with hand sanitizer.
customer_reviews.author: Harley Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Suction is Great
customer_reviews.text: I do lyft part time and this thing is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mathers

customer_reviews.title: Works well for certain phones.
customer_reviews.text: The holder attaches to the dash very well. The adhesion works good and so does the suction provided that you do not extend the phone very far off center. It may work better for lighter phones but not very well for a heavier phone such as a Nexus 6. Additionally, the part that holds the phone may not grip the phone well enough to keep it from falling out especially of you have a heavy duty case for your phone.
customer_reviews.author: EL Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Falls short in every area
customer_reviews.text: In short don't waist your time. On a hot day in direct sun the adhesive melts and it slides down the window leaving a gooey mess. The screw lock breaks the plastic peace after too much time bouncing down roads. The spring holding the mount to the suction cup gets stretched and doesn't fit securely. I've had these for about 8 months and it worked fine for about 2 of those. It's been slowly falling apart and once summer hit it just gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: It Might Damage Your Dashboard
customer_reviews.text: Left a ring on the dashboard. I tried using some leather polish to make it look better. It worked a little (see photo). I'm not sure if this will happen to everybody's dashboard but be careful with yours. It might not ruin yours but if it does, you can keep a phone mount on top of that to cover the damage for good (and for free).
customer_reviews.author: Trading Robot

customer_reviews.title: Won't Stay Adhered To The Windshield
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these mounts in response to our state's new no-hands law. Initially, they all worked well. However, as time went on the suction cup part began to sag to the point that two on the mounts have simply fallen off of the windshield (with no phone installed). Only one remains adhered to the windshield. The two mounts which failed are on cars that are stored in a garage. The mount which still adheres is out in the sun all of the time. It appears that the suction cup stretches to the point that the mount bounces a lot. The second problem is that the adhesive simply loses its grip. Not a good product.
customer_reviews.author: MARY E

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky
customer_reviews.text: I should have returned this sooner after I finally found the one that I REALLY wanted; it wasn't on the internet but at Ross. Unfortunately, I had put the instructions somewhere else and thought that I couldn't return it. I did not use the adhesion. The suction cup was more than sufficient. Don't know what you mean by "security features". I have no need for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Light and Harmony

customer_reviews.title: IT STICKS TO THE DASH
customer_reviews.text: I have an Excursion with a big dash. The window is too far away to suction the phone holder onto. So I needed one that sticks to a dash. This has been stuck to the dash like a killer squid to a fishing boat. It has been on there for many months through 115 degree heat in the summer and 30 degree cold in the winter. I even bought a second one for the truck.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Reid

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't fallen off yet.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was unhappy with the vent phone holder that flopped left & right every time I made a turn in the car. This has been great & is very sturdy. I put it in the center but probably should have put it lower on the window as it obstructs my view a little. I'm afraid to move it now because it's attached so well & they never seem to work as good once you move them. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: L Lanham

customer_reviews.title: WARNING - Suction cup MELTS and BAD!
customer_reviews.text: I would not purchase again as mine also melted and make an nearly impossible mess out of my dash. I should send them a time and materials bill for their lack of quality assurance and testing. Obliviously the company NEVER tested these mounts anywhere it get over 90 degrees or they would have caught this issue. Now IF the company redesigned the suction cup or supplied both their sticky gel and a non-sticky gel suction cups I be willing to give them another chance to win back my business. Lets see if their customer service reaches out to me and offers to make things right. I'll update this review if they do so.
customer_reviews.author: CobraJoe

customer_reviews.title: Suction rubber dissolves overtime
customer_reviews.text: I got this 4 years ago and it started deteriorating. The rubber will leave a messy gooey sticky mess on your dash. I've cleaned mine after summer so it doesnt get hard but leaves a residue. Contacted the compant iottie and it is only warranted for 1 year so this will go to trash. I would never buy an iottie brand products again. Customer service is great but warranty sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Discreet as it can be
customer_reviews.text: I generally do not like this style phone mount because they are bulky and often obstruct the field of view while driving. This device is just small enough to not obstruct but certainly strong enough to not be phased while driving on rough terrain. The bonus was it also works perfectly mounting to the windshield of a boat. Bouncing on rough waves during a busy July 4th weekend did not affect the phone mount at all. I will be getting a second mount to leave dedicated to the boat. Love the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey David Gignac

customer_reviews.title: Bracket that grabs the suction cup is imperfect and allows the phone to bounce on bumpy roads.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this mount. I had it mounted on the windshield. At first, it seemed just fine. I liked the quick release and firm hold it had on my phone. But going into the summer months, the part that holds onto the suction cup relaxes (I'm guessing from the heat?) and it slides down creating a less secure grip and connection to the suction cup. I live in a city that has a lot of bumpy roads and the result of this less secure grip means that my phone bounces around a LOT. I tried resetting the grip and the base and it holds for a short time but then completely goes back to bouncing around.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and ease of placing and removing the phone from the holder.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd time buying this phone holder and I have bought other brands but this one just stands out. Very sturdy and great quality that will last you years before you replace the suction. Our phones have pop sockets of them and you can easily place them without removing your phone cover with pop sockets. I recommend this product looking for a sturdy and quality car phone holder.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit my Pixel phone very well
customer_reviews.text: Got this for use in a second vehicle; I have another version in our primary vehicle. This model is older, and less expensive and works just as well, save for the fact that the side holders interfere with the volume button on my Pixel. It holds the phone well, but always turns the volume completely off, which means you keep having to reset the volume not only at startup, but with bumps along the road, to continue to hear audio alerts or use hands free. As a phone holder--so your cell phone charges and doesn't get thrown around the vehicle--it's great. But using the phone in the holder, that's next to impossible.
customer_reviews.author: David Stipp-Bethune

customer_reviews.title: worked well for 5 years until it broke. re-ordering one now
customer_reviews.text: This served me well for 5 years until it broke. re-ordering one now. I liked that it telescopes out to get closer to my hand Apparently some of the plastic parts inside wore out so the clamping component popped out with the spring. Four stars because of 5 year lifetime. The suction cup only failed on extremely warm days with direct sun on the dash. The suction cup was pretty impressive. It just needs a very flat surface. It did leave some sticky plastic on the dash
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S. Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Time is important
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this phone mount is great, section power is good, adhesion is really tight, security features for the phone is the best, but all this last for about two or three months at most! After that time you lose all those good features specially if you park your car outside in the sun, I know that nothing last forever but at least give me one year; not only 3 months..
customer_reviews.author: Akram Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Finally Died after 3 Years
customer_reviews.text: I have owned about 4 iOttie(s) of different models and this one died recently when an internal spring popped out and the left hand side clamp fell off ending its utility. Other than that (for which I deducted a star for not lasting longer), I generally loved them because they tend to stay in place on the dashboard with zero problems. I immediately ordered a new unit (Touch 4) to replace the one that died and pulled out the original One Touch from retirement as a stop gap measure while waiting for the new one to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: swl

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't stick to anything
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased iottie car mounts before so I had great expectations. This item was a TOTAL disappointment. I dont know if this item was opened and returned or what, but the bottom had zero tackiness. I tried wetting it per the instructions to reactivate it but it did not work. Besides, I should not have to go through all of these changes for a new product. It should have been sticky as soon as I removed the paper backing. I mean this was a drastic change considering I almost needed the jaws of life to remove my last iottie when i sold my car.
customer_reviews.author: A. London

customer_reviews.title: Beware of this product; they have used overly strong ...
customer_reviews.text: Beware of this product; they have used overly strong glue on the rubber cup that is used to attach to your dashboard. The glue was so strong that it ripped the leather covering off the dashboard of my Lexus. DO NOT USE THIS PRODUCT ON YOUR DASHBOARD IT RUINED MY DASHBOARD AND WILL RUIN YOURS. See photo.
customer_reviews.author: Bill_S

customer_reviews.title: Good mount
customer_reviews.text: This is a great inexpensive phone mount. I like that you goes on your dash board instead of the windshield, that way can be closer to reach without obstructing view. It was very easy to install, and feels very sturdy once on. I have a Note5 and it's perfect size for it. The little knob on the bottom that hold the phone up can be move to either side if you need your phone to be plugged for charging or Aux cable. Overall happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and nondurable
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my car's dashboard and within a week the whole contraption fell down while I was driving - which is a GRAVE driving hazard! The glue at the bottom pad does not last long. The idea behind this product is good but the functionality and the execution is zero. I enjoyed it for the 5 days that it held together but I would not recommend it at all. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: Updated for new version - IOTTIE, what were you thinking?
customer_reviews.text: Update for my 3rd Iottie mount. They've cheaped out on the suction cup, and the current incarnation (same one according to Amazon) no longer has the "octopus" feature that enables it to stick to the textured dash, or anything else for that matter. My 2 previous Iotties were amazing - In fact the first one went with that vehicle when I traded it because I couldn't remove it! The suction cup is now smooth-surfaced, and no longer the stand-out amazing feature that made Iottie the only name I would consider. I won't return this one - I accidentally destroyed the box - but I am not a fan of Iottie any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Rob W

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time ordering this. A family member also got this one on their own from a store and absolutely loves it. It’s engineered well, has all the right buttons to create any angle you want. My first one lasted 4 years, and if this one keeps doing what it does I’m just going to stick with getting this in the future. Many friends of mine have different brands and complain about it not working or I see how poorly it holds their phone and doesn’t keep it up right or the adhesive doesn’t hold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase for an oversized device
customer_reviews.text: The description says it works for Galaxy Notes, Galaxy S9 Plus, etc. It is too small. The height of the oversized devices makes them fall out of the cradle which barely is wide enough for my S9+. I love the iOttie suction and adhesion, but I was sold a bill of goods on this mount. Go big or don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: J Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Love this device.
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone mount! It works perfectly in my car. 02 Honda Accord with the support suctioned to the lower center of windshield. I let the bottom of the cradle rest on the dash and it’s great for hands free manipulation. This is my second unit. The first one eventually melted the suction base to the windshield after a few years and it was a bear to clean off but in the products defense it’s so hot here in AZ you can see the gates of Hell in the summertime so when the ambient temps are 120 and the internal temp of your car is 180 to 200 degrees I understand. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: L. Bliss

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Product for our HUGE Phones
customer_reviews.text: This thing is GREAT..Holds our phone securely even on rough roads. We mainly us it for recording Facebook Lives, FB messenger, Youtube videos or making F2F phone calls. The versatility in adjustments makes it a valuable purchase. Our only suggestion for improvement is have a base that adjusts left to right or Swivels. Other than that,, WE LOVE IT and are having A LOT OF FUN using it. Thanks for a great product at an affordable price. Our phone is a Samsung 8 plus in a DEFENDER series Otter Box. Big and Heavy, Which takes the holder to the limit.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for driving for Lyft!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy a mount because I wasn't sure what was going to stick and what I was paying too much for. This one is perfect. Hasn't moved for over a year and I use it almost every time I'm in the car. Side note, the summer did affect the adhesive. It stayed on my car material, but that material bubbled up in the sun and my phone would shut down due to overheating. I would recommend a sunscreen window shade guard the sun on the windshield, but not in the way of your vision, obviously.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Unable to mount on dashboard, the black sticky part doesn’t stick well. I had to take off the black part leaving the clear suction cup and sticking it to my windshield on the driver side because it was as close as I could get it and in the most comfortable reaching position while driving. It serves it purpose but disappointed. Was expecting versatility
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mount Itself is Fine, the Base Sticky Pad Failed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in March, and the adhesive base pad that you put on the dashboard failed already, only 3-4 months later. The sticky layer somehow just came completely loose and stayed on my dashboard, while the plastic bit stayed attached to the mount portion. Granted, the mount portion was still good and plenty adhesive, just the base pad gave out. Had one of these mounts before that lasted me at least 2-3 years, even through Texas summers, before the sticky layers started to fail all around. Disappointed that this replacement for the old one failed after only a few months. Will not be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Nesbitt

customer_reviews.title: Good suction, holds phone well
customer_reviews.text: I’m happy with this product. It was inexpensive and works great. It holds my iphone 5s just fine. The suction holds up well on my dashboard. The weather changes a lot here and that hasn’t affected the suction or anything. Easy to place phone in the holder and take it out. Theres many different places to adjust the angles and loosen or tighten the movement.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Send clumsy to set up but suctions well to dash and works well too
customer_reviews.text: I only have used this Mont on my windshield and not on my dash. When I mounted it at first I thought it was a bit flimsy, but it has never come unsuctioned from my dash, even with grabbing the mount to turn the phone from horizontal to vertical, or vice versa, probably hundreds of times. I thought it was a bit awkward to set up initially, but have been very happy with it since.
customer_reviews.author: imswen

customer_reviews.title: Great for using maps when driving a stick shift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom at Christmas cause she is still getting used to using a smart phone. Yes she was still on a flip phone until about a year ago. And she drives a stick so she is extremely happy with this present. Her car is old so im sure she does not care about her dash like i saw on other reviews. She loves it and would replace it if she needed a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Kirstin Vanak Strelec

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PHONE MOUNT
customer_reviews.text: GREAT PHONE MOUNT. SUCTION STYLE IS GREAT, NO HOLES TO DRILL NO INTERIOR TO RUIN. WOULD GIVE 5 STARS IF PIVOTING FUNCTION OF THE SUCTION CLASP PULLED HARDER TOWARDS THE SUCTION CUP. IF YOUR GLASS GETS HOT IN THE SUN, THE RUBBER SUCTION CUP WILL LOSE SOME OF ITS RIGIDITY, THEREFORE CREATING A SMALL WOBBLE WHEN HITTING BUMPS ON THE ROAD. PLACING A SMALL SHIM UNDER THE PIVOTING CLASP BEFORE CLOSING IT HAS RESOLVED THE SMALL WOBBLE AND I USED A FOLDED PIECE OF CHEWING GUM WRAPPER TO MAKE THE CLASP EVEN HARDER TO CLOSE. THIS HAS MADE THE PHONE MOUNT A SOLID FIXTURE TO MY WINDSHEILD. WILL BE BUYING AGAIN FOR FAMILY MEMBERS
customer_reviews.author: Julio Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Finally, the perfect phone mount!
customer_reviews.text: This iOttie phone mount is perfect for my Honda Fit! It holds securely and does not vibrate on highway and only slightly on gravel roads. The easy on and off is a great benefit. It telescopes plenty to keep my phone close enough to see maps while I’m driving, or to answer a call hands free and be able to hear as well as be heard by a caller. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Rose

customer_reviews.title: SOLID PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I love this holder so much, I have bought it as a gift. WHAT I LIKE: 1. Sturdy 2. Fits large and small phones 3. Stays put on the dash 4. Still works after years of use (My first one is five years old) OVERALL: I would buy this again. It fits in awkward spots and works well.
customer_reviews.author: D. E. M.

customer_reviews.title: The go to mount
customer_reviews.text: This is my "go to" mount. Second one I've bought like this one, 3rd overall (I have a CD mount as well that I modified to bolt underneath my radio). I like to use this one to mount the phone near the steering wheel, mounted to the windshield, on the left side. This way, it does not take your eyes very far off the road, and you can steady your hand against the wheel. I use this position for when I'm using the phone as a GPS unit. These are great mounts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sticks almost too well, but love it for what it does
customer_reviews.text: Sticks REALLY well to anything. I did luckily read the reviews before trying to stick this thing to my dash. Considering how much it holds to the windshield, I'm glad I did. I wish it was a gooseneck, instead of having to hard-adjust it without much flexibility to change that in a spur of the moment need. The build quality is decent, but does feel a little cheap in how it holds the phone, but from what I read that doesn't seem to matter. It does what it says. I like how I can adjust it...just wish it was more flexible and longer.
customer_reviews.author: Some Person

customer_reviews.title: worked well, then the pad melted
customer_reviews.text: I liked this thing well enough to get a second one to take on vacations and use in the rental car... but the one we have at home melted! The 'sticky pad' just melted and dripped down the dashboard. It came off well enough, but now I hav this goo all over the place. We live in Texas and it's just kinda hot here. So I would recommend another product if you live in a hot place. It was fine in cooler areas though.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Side clamps hit volume button on all phones I've used with it. Otherwise good: secure and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The side clamps aren't adjustable, and they hit the volume button on all the phones I've tried with it, so I always have to put the phone higher in the clamp so it's not even touching the bottom foot. That's very annoying, but on the plus side, the clamp is very secure so it stays fine even when put in like that. I like that the bottom foot is adjustable so I can move it to the side to make room for my charging cord. The suction/arm part is great, highly adjustable and very secure. It's been on my car for a year and a half now and it's never come off or budged at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great but just one small thing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and it fits all our phones. I ended up using it. The only complaint is that I like my phone tipped horizontally and it slowly leans downward on the heavier side of the phone even when I completely tighten every knob but still great and I see it being used all over the big city I love in.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Pops off easy after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this a three star review because when it does function it does the job. Sadly though after a few months it will begin to pop off suction device given at random. So you can do a clean perfect install but long term it will still pop. I cleaned it properly and gently for any dust after it popped off and reapplied. It lasts a few weeks then does it again. This product is not one I'd recommend long term. That said though all the adjustments are easy to do and it turns as advertised. So it is an easy addition to add in the car to hold your phone for long travel, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Mittens Slowpaw

customer_reviews.title: And I am sure that is not a good condition to have your expensive phone in
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I had some trouble sticking this up on the dashboard because the sticker was not able to support the arm band well. After several attempts, I managed to stick it on the dashboard, though. Word of caution: something I realized after I bought this is that you should be careful of placing your phone on the mount for long trips. The sun will heat up your phone! And I am sure that is not a good condition to have your expensive phone in, esp. for a long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: SiL B.

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our cross country move. Installing it was a breeze! I really thought it would take a lot longer and more effort. It's held up well with the 2,600+ miles I've traveled so far (more to go too). My only complaint is the swivel ball that allows you to turn and rotate the phone casing has become wobbly. On bumpy highways and roads it will sort of fall or tilt down. Everything is secure though and it doesn't seem to be a case of anything needing tightening. It's just the swivel ball can't handle the super rough roads as well as I would like. Even given that, I would recommend this unit. It's served me quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Long-lasting! Definitely worth the buy when used on the windshield!
customer_reviews.text: I have had the same car mount for 3 years now and it has never let me down! I used it on my windshield and would take it with me whenever I went out of town to use in the rental cars.. today i accidentally knocked it down when pulling my backpack out of the car and it got a lot of debris on the suction cup and will no longer stick.. it was definitely worth the buy though.. although according to the other reviews, I wouldn’t recommend sticking it on the dash.. I prefer the glass because it’s easy to clean off of that.
customer_reviews.author: B Yony R

customer_reviews.title: A definite buy for curved or bumpy dashes.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure about getting this at first but I have to say it is a great design. I have a 2011 Toyota Rav 4 and it fits perfectly centered on the curved portion of the dash just above the middle air vents. I have the telescope arm fully extended. The additional sticky rubber piece is the key to the perfect fit. It holds my Samsung Galaxy Note 8 in my Spigen case just fine and with plenty of extra room on either side. The auto lock in feature is cool as well, just push your phone to the backing and the clamps lock down; release is also a breeze. Just a totally well designed piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: SRB

customer_reviews.title: Update: suction cup disintegrated! Excellent in every way
customer_reviews.text: The suction cup seems to have melted to my windshield and upon removal, become unusable. The mount is now worthless. I contacted iOtti who told me the'd send me a replacement suction cup, but two months later I still have nothing. My follow-up emails have gone unanswered. So much for that. Why did I ever dork around with cheap-o mounts, hoping to save a few bucks and instead struggling in every imaginable way to get it to work? This mount is awesome. Holds cement tight--been on my windshield for two weeks, holding strong. It holds my phone tightly and adjusts easily. And the on touch feature is extremely convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Katerina

customer_reviews.title: Garmin GPS mount fits on the ball end perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Behind the cell phone mount (at the end of the telescoping arm) is a ball that is compatible with Garmin GPS. My Garmin GPS mount fits perfectly on the ball end (see the photo). This is the most stable and convenient mount I've tried thus far. Since I wasn't using my GPS much because of the cumbersome way previous mount worked, this is a surprisingly wonderful discovery. The company should market this to the GPS community, too!
customer_reviews.author: S. H.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Love this mount. I have a Hyundai accent hatchback, the windshield is too distant to mount on it, I was concerned about blocking visibility as well, but this mount works great on the dash. Super adhesive, never had an issue since installation (easy!) about a year ago. All of the knobs allow for customized adjustments. This was recommended through reviews to me, so just passing along a great product, would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mills

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Product!
customer_reviews.text: Only had this in the truck (2015 RAM 1500 Ecodiesel) for about 2 weeks but so far, I very much like the product. Placed it on the dash, just to the left of the small pocket on top. Although the area I placed it does not allow for 100% of the mounting surface to adhere, it's held nicely. Even after about 20 miles of driving wash-board dirt roads on last weeks dove hunt while holding my Samsung S6 Edge. All in all, I'd recommend this product. If I had one complaint, its that it's a rather large contraption....but I imagine that all holders for smartphones these days would have to be.
customer_reviews.author: Vertilli

customer_reviews.title: Best brand of suction cup mount
customer_reviews.text: I liked this mount so much that I bought 3 more for my wife and 2 kids cars. Its big enough to securely hold my phone with its case on (5.5" screen). The button to activate the "grab bars" is really simple and it works every time. The other thing that I like about this mount is that the suction mount is the best that I have used out of 3 different brands. All of the sticky suction mounts will come loose after some months of being stuck on my dashboard, but this one lasts at least 6 months before I may need to re-do the mounting (the other brands only lasted 2-4 months before needing to be re-done).
customer_reviews.author: Michael Besket

customer_reviews.title: I do not like given bad reviews but in this case the people need to be informed!
customer_reviews.text: The mount looks promising from the product description. BUT, the version that I received did not have the locking mechanism (level) to lock down the sucking cup. The sucking cup does indeed leave a mark on just about any surface of the vehicle. It's worse on older vehicles because it can tear out the dash material. I'm not even going bother returning this unit. I do not like given bad reviews but in this case the people need to be informed!
customer_reviews.author: Diego L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: So far this is a great car phone mount. I have a Nissan Rogue and put it on the dash board. So far I haven't had to use the sticky stuff to keep it on. I live in the country and we have very bumpy roads... this mount is hanging on like a trooper! I have saved the sticky adhesive just in case once the weather gets hot I need a better grip though. It's easy to adjust and I really like the way it grabs my phone and holds on tight!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Fields

customer_reviews.title: Not for phone with otter box or big case.
customer_reviews.text: This is not meant for a phone with an otter box case or a large case of any kind. It will not stay on. I’ve used it a couple of times but almost had a heart attack when my iPhone pro max fell off! I think it would work nicely for a phone with a slimmer case though. It’s pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Lindyloo

customer_reviews.title: good mount, bad design.
customer_reviews.text: its a good, strong mount. however, the bottom tab that 'holds' your phone in place in portrait mode is not removable. meaning, if you decide (like most people) to tilt your phone into landscape mode, your phone will be off center and hanging off the edge. looks really weird and will likely put more stress on the side that is hanging off!
customer_reviews.author: Atomic from Texas

customer_reviews.title: Three stars because of issues I have had over time.
customer_reviews.text: Over time the adhesive starts to run and the mount lets go when you put the phone in it with extended arm. Over all this product has been a good product but when I upgraded my iPhone I haven’t been able to use it because of this issue. Looking in to buying another one because over all it is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: bigben

customer_reviews.title: iOttie makes the best in-car phone mounts
customer_reviews.text: iOttie makes the best mounts. Sticks strong, durable plastic construction, fairly easy to use/install. The way you mount your phone into the actual device is pretty neat and works well. After your phone is seated into this holder, your device will remain secure and stable for the most part. Only if you drive and hit pretty rough road, you may see it wobble just slightly, but that is expected.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing to death. I use it to and from any destination. The only thing that really irks me is that the suction cup melts since its hit by the sun 24/7 so I've had to replace it a couple times. It's always worth the money, but the melting suction cup makes me sad, especially when I have to clean up the goo from my dashboard.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT FOR BMW M5
customer_reviews.text: The suction cup has sticky residue on it to help it stick. Place it carefully the first time or you'll leave a mark of sticky that will not come off easily. The suction thing will stick even if you don't push the (very) hard to press suction button. Works on window tinted windshields (for those of you who care about that). Only managed to make the cell phone pop off once, while doing some extreme maneuvers sideways and over multiple train tracks. lol. BMW M5.
customer_reviews.author: Kebs Pow

customer_reviews.title: Compresses power/volume buttons.
customer_reviews.text: The holder provides many options for mounting in the car and seems to work well in most aspects.. The BIG problem with it, based on my experience, is that with most cell phones the side brackets that "clasp" the phone are going to be on either the volume control, the power button, or both and the phone may not operate properly. If you place the phone so as to avoid this situation it rides higher in the holder an is not as secure as it should be. Because my cell is 5.5", it has fallen out of the holder on rough or bumpy roads so I tend to not use the holder as much as I normally would.
customer_reviews.author: Rperry38

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for my Van with the Expanding Arm if You Like Your Phone Closer to You
customer_reviews.text: The thing I HATE about most of these vehicle phone mounts is that you still have to reach a long ways - not with this one, using the expanding arms, I mount this on the dash and my phone is right there close to the steering wheel. I realize that most of the time you don't need to touch your phone with all the integrated electronics in newer cars, but I just like my phone a little closer, maybe it's my vision, although I don't wear glasses, except for readers
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Durbin

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Very good. Strong suction to windshield. Telescoping arm very helpfully. You may have to use the pad to attach to dashboard if you want to attach it that way. Pad might damage dash. Try to place it correctly the first time. You probably do not want this one if you want remove it often.
customer_reviews.author: Kiley

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't suggest it. Read my review.
customer_reviews.text: The clamps do not hold a phone well with a case, the suction is weak and will fall off if it gets hot in the car, tightening mechanism is frail plastic and broke, there fore the neck could not hold the phone upright. Suction is weak and will not hold the phone upright and will tilt due to phone's weight.
customer_reviews.author: Esmeralda Zanotti

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mount .
customer_reviews.text: Best dashmout there is. I've bought 5 already. Yet to have my phone fall out of it. I'm a commercial truck driver . All that rattling. Vibration. Constant unmounting. Still no issues. Love it . Got my siblings one each also . Left1 in each truck I drive . Every driver loves it . Fyi for those dummies who have residue left from mounting it . Goo gone will clean it up. Word of advise if you not sure stick it to windshield. Only permanent mount to dash surface if you won't remove it . Trust me it's going no where .neither will it let the phone go anywhere
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works great when suctioned to windshield!
customer_reviews.text: 10 stars for iOttie's customer service!!! I couldn't get this device to stick and stay on the dashboard of my 2014 Ford Escape. iOttie happened to be contacting me to check and see how my husband'swas working and I mentioned how much he loved his but I was having difficulty with mine. They replaced mine with a One Touch 3 after asking for pictures, a description of the problem, and a copy of my receipt. We ended up sticking the original One Touch 2 onto the windshield after it'd fallen off the dash at least three times, and the suction so far has held. I would recommend using the windshield not the dash.
customer_reviews.author: Troublemaakerz

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable phone holder.
customer_reviews.text: I mounted the holder onto my dash, and unlike the experience of some other users there has been no damage to the faux leather surface. The phone snaps in and is easily removed, just as described. I have used this holder for just over a year, and I'm looking to replace it with something better. This product has failed multiple times in two ways. My iPhone 5 has shaken out of the holder on bumpy roads--the phone basically goes flying and this could easily result in a broken screen. Also, the holder itself has detached from the dash, and this problem has gotten worse, presumably as the suction mechanism has aged poorly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey T Ihara

customer_reviews.title: Sticky gel melting in mild weather during long distance road trip
customer_reviews.text: Bought total four of those mounts. We really like the one-touch mounting, the lock/release mechanism and the telescopic arm. But the Sticky Gel Pad dosen't stay on when the dashboard gets warmer. We drove from Northern California to Las Vegas on a mild winter day last December. The gel melted completely that dropped our iPhone 6 Plus on the floorboard in the car many times unexpectedly. We ended up holding our phones by hands in order to follow Google map routing instructions to avoid traffic congestion.
customer_reviews.author: W. D.

customer_reviews.title: Straight-up good, on the case
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine. No quality issues noted. Stays on the dash as expected. My phone has a protective case on it (with the built in stand). The cradle barely holds on to the phone, LG G4. So long as the phone is sitting vertical and leaned back a little it works just fine; the phone doesn't shift when touched. Horizontal viewing and operation is not going to work in this cradle if using a thicker phone case. The lock and release function works well and feels sturdy. I would recommend this cradle if you don't mind viewing the phone vertically (example; map or music apps).
customer_reviews.author: dmos

customer_reviews.title: Rubber grip has fallen off, easy fix with a file to carve a groove to accept the edge of the phone
customer_reviews.text: Hardly used and one of the pads on the gripper has fallen off. No pad, no grip, no holding of the phone. Nearly caused an accident when normal bumps in the road shook my phone out of the holder, and then rattled down my dashboard to the floor mats. One star for crappy adhesive on the gripper. UPDATE: I used a metal file and carved a notch where the gripper pad used to be, and now my phone fits right into it, and is held firm. The suction cup is awesome, the holder itself is stable and sturdy. Four stars!
customer_reviews.author: Wickedeyepoke

customer_reviews.title: best purchase i have ever made on amazon ( and ...
customer_reviews.text: best purchase i have ever made on amazon ( and i buy A LOT). solid, clever, flexible. has never moved or failed me - use it all day long. makes me happy just to look at it - clever design and indestructable. this is the second one our family has bought. Just genius design, easy to use, you dont have to take your eyes off the rd to click it in OR to release it. I love finding a product, in this day and age of crap and cheap junk, i love finding a product that does what it says , is easy to install, and has stood the test of time. thank you! Great
customer_reviews.author: harriet vane

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend this Product!
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased 3 of these over the years for each of our vehicles, including those we drive for work. They are easy to use, articulate well, and make hands free driving easy and safe. The mounting adhesive has excellent staying power without damaging your dashboard, or wherever you decide to place it. They only downside is if your surface is textured or heavily angled, the weight of the holder and phone won't hold for very long and will likely fall off. I had this problem in one of my work vehicles, but considered it a flaw on the vehicle, not the product itself (the angle was more than 45-degress and was a VERY bumpy surface).
customer_reviews.author: T. &  A. Newsome

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Plan your location site, and use common sense before mounting it..
customer_reviews.text: One of the best holders I have used to date, at a very attractive price. It is versatile and effective. It has great range of motion and sticks well in the cold season. I trust this will be fine in the heat of the warmer months. I suggest you read the directions, carefully, and follow them precisely. I would never attach anything like this to my dashboard. With any product such as this, there has to be a trade-off, so just use common sense before mounting it. A little forethought and planning will save you from any damage that I have seen complained about in many of the posts.
customer_reviews.author: S MARS

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly for 11 Months, Now it Sucks at Sucking
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked great! Until it did not work at all. After a year of working perfectly, it fell off my dash. I re-stuck it... but it would never stay on for more than a day. I even bought a new adhesive pad to stick on my dash, but the problem was with the suction cup base of the actual mount—it simply will not adhere to anything anymore. Not the window, original base or replacement base. The good news is, it left no residue or damage on my dash. The bad news is I got really used to having my phone mounted just so. Change is hard.
customer_reviews.author: Justin J. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Will come off when the car sits in the hot sun
customer_reviews.text: I've had the product for two weeks. The dashboard pad that is supposed to help the suction cup stick to uneven surfaces came apart after sitting in the sun. The entire adhesive layer stayed on the dashboard but came off of the pad itself. The pad could potentially be reapplied, but I fear that it may happen with my phone attached and do not want to risk it falling while I'm driving (also possibly damaging my phone screen from falling onto my shifter). The adhesive will also probably be weaker each time it is reapplied.
customer_reviews.author: yami

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when I first started driving because I had no idea where my girlfriends house was when we firstborn started dating and I so happened to be getting my drivers license around that same time so I found this, bought it, and here I am almost 3 years later and the suction/adhesive is still working and hasn’t lost its ability to stick to my dashboard yet. Even got a new car, took it out of the old one, put it in the new and it’s still working today.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Johnson

customer_reviews.title: robust, simple, excellent.
customer_reviews.text: This is robust and easy to use. I shopped for a long time, and ultimately this was only part of my solution, but it's WONDERFUL. The sticky suction cup did leave a mark on my dash (I only tried it for a few hours, for fear of exactly that) but I was able to undo any damage. I ended up making my own custom ball mount for it, (so the telescoping/suction part now sits in a drawer somewhere), but it's amazing. I really love the 1-handed operation, and the swivel functionality of the ball mount. Great work, iOttie!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Kalinoski

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay attached to dashboard
customer_reviews.text: Despite following the directions to the letter, I was not able to install this device to my dashboard. The gel pad had insufficient grip to hold the device in place, even without adding the phone. It repeatedly flew off and landed on the floor. Indeed, simply closing the car door was enough to jar it loose. Perhaps if it were possible to stand over this device during installation to apply maximum pressure, we would have had a better result, but it isn't and we didn't. I do not want to install this device on the windshield, so will have to find another product.
customer_reviews.author: Swimmer's mom

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I installed the iOttie on my car Sunday. It worked great for 2 days. The springs that open and close to put the phone in stopped working. I have an iPhone 8 and it's supposed to work for it. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Fox

customer_reviews.title: adjusted review
customer_reviews.text: In my first review, i noted that I though the design was stupid since the clip on the bottom of the mount blocked the power connection. The folks at iOtti were on the ball an contacted me and very politely explained that the clip slides from side to side to accommodate a power connection. So now this company has proven not only can they make a fantastic car mount, they also have shown how they can get out in front of a potential bad customer experience snd turn it right around. Bravo iOtti, I will not only be back to purchase items for myself. But I will recommend you to my friends as well. You guys do it right!
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Stays on windshield. Not dash
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered this a while ago and it was alright. I’d give it more if it had stuck to my dash the way I wanted but it did not. So to make it work I stuck it to my windshield it stayed. Never fell off the windshield and was fine. Occasionally phone fell out but I assumed I hadn’t clicked it right. However my boyfriend took it off (I had positioned it and kind of blocked my rearview mirror. I am a short person) now I can’t restick it. Am considering buying again because I can’t find another I kind of trust
customer_reviews.author: Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Force of Suction is weak, failing to take shock from driving rough roads.
customer_reviews.text: The DESIGN is excellent EXCEPT for one thing: the force of suction. I have purchased two of these for which I had to return twice. Each time, it lasted only for 2-3 weeks because when you drive around, the capacity to take the shock from making turns, hitting rough roads or potholes, is poor. After 2-3 weeks, the sticky adhesive and the suction force will no longer hold this mount holder, even on a beautiful nice flat surface. Ottie needs to redesign the SUCTION so that the FORCE is capable of holding a bowling ball being moved to & fro, side to side.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Of Arc

customer_reviews.title: Best phone holder ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Look no further, this is it!! All I can say is my husband won't stop asking me to order these! He wants one in every vehicle, and so far that's exactly what's happening. I've even been asked by strangers where I got it from. It has such a sleek look, and maneuvers well. Let me just say the suction power and how it adheres to your surface whether window or dash is amazzzzing!!! Your phone isn't going any place based on the foundation! So, I would highly recommend ordering, as it's a great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: LeRose Preferred Goods

customer_reviews.title: Works great, adheres well, and has great adjustability.
customer_reviews.text: It fits a wide variety of phones. The suction base works on windshields and with the added gooey disc, works on dashboards. Using the gooey base, once in place, there's no moving it. Either way, there are lots of adjustments. This allows you to position the phone within your peripheral vision but not block your view of the road. I like this far more than clipping a phone to a heater/ac vent or mounting the phone down near the console. Best of all, the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Arocars

customer_reviews.title: Stickiness doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item at the end of March. It worked great until a couple of weeks ago. I put my phone in the holder and it slowly dropped forward, while I was driving regretfully. The stickiness just stopped sticking. I tried to reattach it, but to no avail. I think it was great until the weather started to warm it. I was thinking that it could've been the heat on the dashboard. It's been in the 70's so it's not really hot. I would say in worked great for 2 1/2 months. Now it's trash. I don't know why it got so many great reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until it broke.
customer_reviews.text: I had this model for about 22 months and then it just kind of came apart. Prior to that it held up pretty well. It held the phone well in both vertical and horizontal positions. It had a good strong grip on various sizes phones. The suction did have a tendency to lose it's adhesiveness during the hot Georgia summer months, but that is to be expected. I was a bit disappointed when it came apart out of the blue. I am not sure I would buy it again or not.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Sweat

product_meta.title: iOttie Easy One Touch 2 Car Mount Holder Universal Phone Compatible with IPhone XS Max R 8/8 Plus 7 7 Plus 6s Plus 6s 6 SE Samsung Galaxy S8 Plus S8 Edge S7 S6 Note 9
product_meta.description:
Pattern Name:HolderThe iOttie Easy One Touch 2 provides a safe, versatile and highly functional smartphone mounting solution. Like its predecessors, the One Touch Universal & the One Touch XL, our new One Touch 2 is packed with standard features like the iOttie patented one touch locking feature as well as the iOttie super sticky gel pad. The iOttie One Touch 2 also includes new features as well. It includes a new two-step locking lever which ensures your mount can be used on different surfaces. The first locking position can be used for flat, smooth surfaces, while the second locking position can be used on curvy textured surfaces that may require more grip. The One Touch 2 also offers a telescopic arm which extends up to 2 additional inches to provide you with even more viewing options when using your mount. The One Touch 2 also provides a new sliding bottom foot. Our redesigned bottom foot ensures that there is no interference with your devices bottom ports. The stickiness of the suction cup is infinite, just rinse with warm water and let air dry, restoring the gel pad to like new condition. No matter if your phone is protected by a skin or a case, the iOttie Easy One Touch 2 Car Mount grips securely onto your device so you can drive with confidence. Mount Smart. Drive Smarter!

Please Note: iOttie is not responsible for any potential damage to textured dashboards that may be caused by our products. If you have a concern about dashboard damage we do recommend mounting the car mount on your windshield (state law permitting). You may also consider our Air Vent or CD Slot Car Mounts.
feature_bullets: Now includes the new iOttie Sticky Gel Dashboard Pad which allows more flexibility as well as a smooth surface on textured and curved surfaces
ADJUSTABLE BOTTOM FOOT: Bottom foot can move left or right to allow the ability to charge your device

Easy one touch mounting system locks and releases the device with just a push of a finger; Super sticky gel pad sticks securely to most surfaces, yet is still easily removable (please note, most likely will not work on leather/ vinyl dashboards)

Compatible Device :iPhone X/XR/X Max/XS Max/XS/8/8 Plus/7/7 Plus/6/6 Plus/5s/5c/5/4S; Samsung Galaxy S9/S9 Plus/S8 Plus/S8 Edge/S7/S6/S5/S4/S3/S2/Note 8/5/4/3/2; HTC One M8; Google Nexus 5/4; LG G2/G3. Please note: This product opens to 3.2 inches in width, which makes it compatible with the iPhone 6 Plus which is 3.09 inches in width

New telescopic arm adds 2 inches to allow for closer device viewing. The stickiness of the suction cup is infinite just rinse with warm water and air dry and this will restore the gel pad to like new condition

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars20,397 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
